loz  breath of the wild the pinnacle of the medium, nothing this year comes even close to this, and some of the most fun ive ever had with a videogame. brilliance
kingdom hearts hd 2.8 final chapter prologue

tales of berseria i had a ton of fun and its the only 2017 game that i put over 100 hours into. the characters and story were memorable, the gameplay was fun, the story was good, and the whole journey was excellent

finding paradise long awaited sequel of to the moon, with highest high and lowest low compared to the prequel... its impossible to talk about this kind of game without spoiler so i must say that this game is too relatable in my life

3. sonic mania yes, sonic its back. more fast than ever and still some heroes players like tails and knuckles. loved everything about this game
the legend of heroes  trails in the sky the 3rd
metroid samus returns  a great return to form and one of the finest 2d metroids. great level design considering they had to stick with the metroid 2 formula, and i have great hopes for metroid 5
rock of ages 2 bigger and boulder a great tower defense bowling racing hybrid that gave me tons of hours of enjoyment. brilliant multiplayer mode and funny story mode
sonic mania this game exceeded my expectations and was just as fun if not more fun than the genesis games. the music is amazing as well
nioh i had my eyes on this game since trying the beta, and team ninja delivered on a game with very satisfying combat and many many customization options
final fantasy xii thé zodiac age
shadow tactics blade of the shogun
danganronpa v3 killing harmony those infamous ending is really something

ac origins the scale of this game is like nothing else, but what really sets this above other ac games for me is the qol improvements that keep what is essentially icon checking fun no annoying animations when looting, a destiny like ui, ability to keep your favourite weapons throughout the game atc
south park the fractured but whole tbd
sonic mania please sonic team only make 2d sonic games from now on!
dungeons & dragons online mists of ravenloft

injustice 2 great story and fun fighting game
phoenix wright ace attorney spirit of justice
hollow knight decent metroidvania but sadly outshadowed my metroid this year. it has some highlights to it but the lack of good movement options limited my enjoyment
kingdom hearts ii.8 final chapter prologue
evil within 2 demo makes want want to own this game... like, now. the imagery alone would make me buy this game
cuphead crazy style in this game, and the gameplay is super rewarding!
sonic mania a great return to form for sonic, would have preffered if sonic forces was one too
star wars battlefront ii lacklustre campaign but very fun multiplayer

final fantasy xii the ivalice world is by far my favorite ff setting fft is my goat after all and it was a blast getting back into it with this remaster. the cast is great, and the combat system with dual classes and a detailed combat script is amazing
xcom2 war of the chosen really enjoyed the vanilla games, and then this amazing dlc revamped the strategy and gameplay layers to give me a whole new experience
the legend of heroes trails of cold steel
final fantasy xii  the zodiac age
pokémon ultra sun and ultra moon
night in the woods wandering aimlessly after college? thats so me
cuphead nostalgia pandering never failed to excite me
xenoblade chronicles 2 beatiful world, that begs you to explore it. amazing story, only pulled down by some qol issues that i could ignore and still find this game amazing
xcom 2 war of the chosen xcom2 was allready good, this expansion pushes that agenda even further, adding so much and making the game so much better
nioh underrated gem of a game. creative mechanics and brutally fun difficulty something i always enjoy
fire emblem echoes boring and tedious gameplay makes this game mediocre at best. bummer since its my soundtrack of the year
xenoblade 2 no way im going to finish it by jan 21

no reserving posts to hold your ballot until later. this clogs up the thread with wasted space and ensures that fewer people will actually see your list. such posts will disqualify your ballot, even if edited later
no posting unofficial, preliminary results. this may influence voting
mario & luigi super star saga & bowsers minions
ghost recon wildlands deep open world game very good
la noire switch loved it when it came out had to replay it again
star wars battlefront 2 fun starwars shooter
the legend of heroes  trails of cold steel
final fantaxy xv masters of the deep vr
cuphead this was a ride, i kind of burnt myself out on it after a while. it was pretty much one and done for me but its still such an original and beautiful game i want it on my list
call of duty world war ii
shovel knight spectre knight despite owning shovel knight, i never played more that 5 hours of it. because this was an early switch purchase, i played all the way through this one. a great platformer
super hyper cube on steam vr
destiny 2 bungie delivered a game with really good gameplay, and i love the destiny universe they created
pyre supergiant games keep pleasantly surprising me with aesthetically stunning games and really fun gameplay! the rpg   sports gameplay loop they implemented was really fun
prey i really enjoyed the story and the variety of way in which you could approach the quest objectives
mass effect andromeda although it was nowhere as great as it could have been with respect to the ot, i really loved what bioware tried to do with the exploration and combat with this entry
sonic mania glitter of hope for future sonic saga
crash bandicoot  n sane trilogy still as good as i remembered
cat quest generic indie rpg with cute cats brilliant
elex the combat is workman like, but everything else about this rpg is good.   and every open world game should have a jet pack to get around
elite dangerous the first 20 hours were so good that i overlooked how awfully tedious the underlying mechanics actually are
cuphead hard and rewarding gameplay with a beatiful animation style
metroid samus returns samus is back baby, in this amazing reimagination of the original game, improving it even further
cuphead brilliant artistry and hard work make this passion project so much more than a run n gun shmup. i hope theres more of this to come in the future

golf story what a surprise! this game almost seems like shovelware at first glance, but after finishing it i realize it to be one of the years best original takes. superb music, good humor and golf as the catalyst for the whole story and game
samus returns i found it mediocre and dropped it, but at least metroid is back!
fifa 18 switch version is bad, xbox one version is okay havent played the series since forever, but doesnt feel much has change, plus the story was pretty meh overall
